raw_mentions:
Despite being able to bind and block both SIRPai and SIRPa<sub>B</sub>rr, SE5A5 is not capable of blocking SIRPa signalling as measured by blocking of the recruitment of SHP-1. 
Some other prior art antibodies that are able to bind both SIRPai and SIRPa<sub>B</sub>rr without binding SIRPy are not able to block CD47 binding to SIRPa and hence do not, or only at a high IC50 concentration, block SIRPa signalling as measured by blocking of the recruitment of SHP- 1.

Here are the extracted sentences with the required components:

* The binding is indicated as an EC50 value in Table 4, with most antibodies displaying an EC50 value in the low pg/ml range.
* AB115-LALA, 3F9-LALA and 7H9-LALA show an EC50 value that is greater than 1 pg/ml for binding to U937 cells.
* 3F9-LALA binds to huSIRPai and huSIRPaBrr expressed on ExpiCHO-S cells with an EC50 value greater than 1 pg/ml.
* All tested antibodies bind huSIRPBiV2, with antibody 6 having the highest KD and thus the lowest affinity, with KD values in the range of M.
* Estimated KDS are within the tested concentration range, with values less than 1.0E11, but when < 1.0E11 is the reported KD value, the affinity could not accurately be determined because the kinetic parameters are outside the instruments specifications.

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:


Table 6. Cellular binding of anti-SIRPa antibodies to granulocytes, CD14<sup>+</sup> monocytes and CD3<sup>+</sup> T-cells in whole blood of healthy heterozygous SIRPai/SIRPa<sub>B</sub>rr donors (al/aBIT) or a homozygous SIRPai/SIRPai donor (al/al). 
>10 = EC50 > than 10 mg/ml 
EC50 values were calculated as the concentration in pg/ml that gives a response half way between bottom and top of the curve, when using a 4- parameter logistic fit. 
A summary of the EC50 values is depicted in Table 6. 
While most antibodies show binding to CD3<sup>+</sup> T- cells, antibody 6, AB3-LALA, 3F9-LALA, 7H9-LALA and HEFLB do not show binding to CD3<sup>+</sup> T-cells. 
This appears to be in alignment with the disclosure in WO2018/057669 that Abl36 binds to SIRPy, but with a low KD.
